newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton ends higher on mixed buying.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton ends higher on mixed buying.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures recouped earlier losses and settled higher, lifted by mixed and steady buying throughout the afternoon, floor sources said.
Once the locals broke through stops around 75.00 cents a lb in March delivery, trade and light speculative buying emerged to carry the spot month to the day's highs.
Technical resistance at 75.30 and price fixing at the day's highs capped the rally. Traders pegged the next level of resistance at 75.50 cents for March cotton.
They said the market is likely to retrace gains Tuesday if there is no follow-through on the open.
Steady export business would support prices in the longer term, analysts said.
March ended up 0.66 at 75.26, traded 75.30 to 74.30. The back months settled 0.53 higher to 0.20 lower.
